poem:
### Labubu Lament

Labubu, tangled in counterfeit dreams,  
sails on a ship of broken seams.  
Borders buzz with the clatter of toys—  
fluffy faces hiding perilous ploys.  
Chemical whispers in plastic grins,  
smuggling dangers where innocence begins.  
A storm of fakes floods the hand,  
lost in a playland built on barren sand.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Fake Labubu dolls account for 90% of counterfeit toys seized at UK border Fake Labubu dolls accounted for 90% of counterfeit toys seized at the UK border this year, with many found to contain banned chemicals or pose choking hazards. Border officials intercepted almost 259,000 counterfeit toys worth more than £3.5m, including 236,000 fake versions of Pop Mart’s toothy, fluffy Labubu dolls. Most of the seized toys – 75% – failed safety tests with banned". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
